Key Match Events: India won the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup final by seven runs against South Africa.
Virat Kohli scored 76 runs off 59 balls.
Jasprit Bumrah bowled a miserly 18th over, conceding only two runs and taking a wicket.
Suryakumar Yadav took a brilliant catch to dismiss David Miller in the last over.
Axar Patel and Virat Kohli had a 72-run fourth-wicket partnership.
Hardik Pandya took three crucial wickets for 20 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli announced their retirement from T20Is after India’s World Cup win.
Rohit Sharma expressed that the victory was a result of efforts over the past 3-4 years.
Virat Kohli expressed relief and joy after the win, looking up to the sky with hands aloft.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India set a challenging total of 176 for seven after winning the toss.
South Africa was bowled out for 169 in 20 overs.
Axar Patel was run out due to a lazy piece of running.
